org.cast.cwm.glossary
Class BaseGlossaryPanel

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.wicket.Component
      org.apache.wicket.MarkupContainer
          org.apache.wicket.markup.html.WebMarkupContainer
              org.apache.wicket.markup.html.WebMarkupContainerWithAssociatedMarkup
                  org.apache.wicket.markup.html.panel.Panel
                      org.cast.cwm.glossary.BaseGlossaryPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, org.apache.wicket.IClusterable, org.apache.wicket.IConverterLocator, org.apache.wicket.markup.html.IHeaderPartContainerProvider
public abstract class BaseGlossaryPanel
extends org.apache.wicket.markup.html.panel.Panel

This is intended to be an easy-to-extend base class for a Panel that displays a glossary entry and controls for navigating through a glossary. It implements some of the tricky parts like sorted lists of words, indicators for current and empty glossary sections, etc.

See Also:

getGlossary

protected abstract Glossary getGlossary()
Implementer must define this to return the glossary to be displayed.

Returns:
a Glossary

getGlossaryPageClass

protected abstract Class<org.apache.wicket.markup.html.WebPage> getGlossaryPageClass()
Returns:
the page class for glossary - expected to be implemented in the application file

newXmlComponent

protected abstract org.apache.wicket.Component newXmlComponent(String string,
                                                               org.apache.wicket.model.IModel<? extends IXmlPointer> xmlSection)
Implementer must define this to create and return an XmlComponent for the given section model (which will be the glossary definition) Abstract since applications generally subclass XmlComponent and will want to construct the component using their subclass.

Parameters:
id -
xmlSection - holding the definition's XmlSection
Returns:
an XmlComponent showing the definition.

entry - Glossary entry; may be null.

newDefinitionContainer

protected org.apache.wicket.Component newDefinitionContainer(IGlossaryEntry entry)
Create and return a Component to show the definition of the word. If no word is being defined, this function will still be called, but the argument will be null.

Parameters:
id -
entry - Glossary entry; may be null.
Returns:
a Component displaying the definition
